text: Justinas Marazas (born 23 February 2000) is a Lithuanian footballer who plays as a right midfielder for Riteriai, and the Lithuania national team. ==Career== As professional started in 2017 m., when played first match in A Lyga.https://www.delfi.lt/sportas/futbolas/17-metis-a-lygos-debiutantas-j- marazas-svarbiausia-buvo-suprasti-kad-tai-ne-vaiku-zaidimas.d?id=74764596 In first half of 2019 he was loaned and played in polish Wisla Plock. In summer 2019 he returned to FK Riteriai.https://alyga.lt/naujiena/j-marazas-grizo-i- riterius/6180 ==Career in national team== Marazas made his international debut for Lithuania on 22 March 2019, coming on as a substitute for Saulius Mikoliūnas in the 76th minute of the UEFA Euro 2020 qualifying match against Luxembourg, which finished as a 1–2 away loss. ==Career statistics== ===International=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !colspan=3|Lithuania |- !Year!!Apps!!Goals |- |2019||2||0 |- !Total!!2!!0 |} ==Honours== Individual *A Lyga Young Player of the Year: 2018 * A Lyga Young Player of the Month: April 2018 ==References== ==External links== * * * * Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:People from Elektrėnai Municipality Category:Lithuanian footballers Category:Lithuania youth international footballers Category:Lithuania under-21 international footballers Category:Lithuania international footballers Category:Lithuanian expatriate footballers Category:Lithuanian expatriate sportspeople in Poland Category:Expatriate footballers in Poland Category:Association football midfielders Category:FK Riteriai players Category:Wisła Płock players Category:A Lyga players Category:Ekstraklasa players
title: Justinas Marazas
